meanings.definition: Orchestrate: to arrange or direct the elements of a situation to produce a desired effect
meanings.sent1: The teacher orchestraters the classroom activities to keep the students engaged.
meanings.sent2: She orchestraters the event to ensure everything runs smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The chef orchestraters the ingredients in the kitchen like a maestro conducting a symphony.
meanings.sent4: The captain orchestraters the team's plays like a skilled conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The director orchestraters the scenes in the movie with precision and creativity.

meanings.definition: Orchestrator: a person who arranges or directs the elements of a situation to produce a desired effect
meanings.sent1: The orchestrators of the project worked tirelessly to bring all the pieces together.
meanings.sent2: As the orchestrator of the campaign, she ensured every detail was perfect.
meanings.sent3: The orchestrator of the surprise party managed to keep it a secret from everyone.
meanings.sent4: The orchestrator of the dance performance coordinated the dancers flawlessly.
meanings.sent5: The orchestrator of the mission led the team to success with their strategic planning.
